title: Implement endless scroll + follow best practice for setting adapter
message:
Implement endless scroll + follow best practice for setting adapter

Call asynctask when the user reaches the bottom of the recipe list. This
gives the illusion of endless scroll.

Create the recipe adapter only once on creation and then notify when
there is a change to the recipe list to reduce overhead.

title: Handle multiple words in query search + launch browser intent on recipe click
message:
Handle multiple words in query search + launch browser intent on recipe click

Replace spaces with "+" in query edit text: i.e. search for "mexican
chili".
Once a recipe is clicked, launch its url in a browser.

title: Sync checkbox and textview clicks
message:
Sync checkbox and textview clicks

There was a bug where we had the checkbox onclick listener in our
ingredients adapter while our textview onclick listener was in our
ingredient fragment. Both appeared to sync up but they weren't in
the background.
Move the listener for the textview into the ingredients adapter.
Handle all click events and send the list of selected ingredients
over to the ingredients fragment.

title: Allow users to query a recipe keyword w/ ingredients selection
message:
Allow users to query a recipe keyword w/ ingredients selection

Add an EditText field to the ingredients fragment. recipe puppy allows
api calls that take a keyword search in the url request. With this
functionality users can select ingredients they want to use or just
type in a single word query for a list of recipes; i.e. "pancakes".

title: Update call to AsyncTask on swipe to recipes tab
message:
Update call to AsyncTask on swipe to recipes tab

Grab a list of checked ingredients from the parent activity and update
the url that will be used to make the api request. Also re-call
the asynctask's execute on swipe event. This is working normally, but
when user unchecks one ingredient, the other ingredient is automatically
"checked"; i.e. its isSelected() returns true although it is not checked
in the list view.

title: Implement interface for fragment-to-fragment communication
message:
Implement interface for fragment-to-fragment communication

Follow:
https://developer.android.com/training/basics/fragments/communicating.html
Define an interface in the Ingredient Fragment class and
implement it within Main Activity. Use OnPageChangeListener
as the interface. We will then be able to send the ingredient
titles (on select) to the recipes fragment to make an API
request.

title: Tie checkboxes w/ items
message:
Tie checkboxes w/ items

Syncronize the item checks with the item's checkboxes.

title: Set foundation for batch contextual actions
message:
Set foundation for batch contextual actions

Allow batch contextual actions to Ingredients ListView
rather than enabling the contextual action mode for an
individual view.
https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/menus.html#context-menu

title: View Holder Pattern + Contextual Action Mode
message:
View Holder Pattern + Contextual Action Mode

Implement View Holder Pattern in the Recipe Adapter and

fragment.

title: Utilize View Holder Design Pattern in Ingredients Adapter
message:
Utilize View Holder Design Pattern in Ingredients Adapter

Begin implementing contextual menu upon clicking an

also from the DB isn't working at the moment.

title: Refactor DB
message:
Refactor DB

Revamp the database layer. Separate DBHelper into two classes; SQLiteDAO
and SQLiteDBHelper. The DAO will act as the interface to the database
for other classes and be responsible for maintaining the database
connection, inserting, deleting, etc. The DBHelper will be responsible
for CRUD operations; creating the database, dropping tables, updating,
reading. Hopefully this will simplify things a bit.

Move loose text in xml files to the strings.xml.

Rename xml files for more consistency.

Remove extra buttons from ingredients fragment. Prepare for using the
action bar.
